column4: hey.. I am trying to install ubuntu through the net using the proxy apt-cacher-ng while it is offline. The prob is that everytime it gets to the fetching release files stage it bombs out saying that the repo is not available. So my question is what is the recommended program to install to get the installer thinking it is interfacing with the internet?
how can you download threw a offline proxy
then you have a server side issue
you must be missing files
why go threw all this anyways
if its networks use the net
making a pxe installer server would be the best way
I have
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Installation/LocalNet
just a matter of pluging them in
you cant massboot offline
you need some kind of local server
well you cant move file by magic
for the offline ones you need a cd or something
no cd drives
for the networks ones you can make a pxe innstaller server
they netboot aand install the os
usb boot the non networked ones or something
or even a pce boot floppy
or walk around with a usb stick netboot them with a ubuntu network install
once it starts installing you can move to the next pc
you best option is hear https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/Netboot you make a pxe server with the ubuntu cd as its os and it can mass install over a network
